Class CtState

  • java.lang.Object
    • lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.java.system.types.primary.CtState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class CtState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Class CtState which has the systems's status.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      DtDateAndTime clock
      The current system date and time.
      DtSecond crisisReminderPeriod
      The set crisis reminder period, if a crisis hasn't been handled within the period, coordinators will be warned.
      DtSecond maxCrisisReminderPeriod
      The max crisis reminder period, if a crisis hasn't been handled within the period, coordinators will be warned.
      DtInteger nextValueForAlertID
      The next available value for alert id, this is retrieved from the database at moment of system and environment creation.
      DtInteger nextValueForCrisisID
      The next available value for crisis id, this is retrieved from the database at moment of system and environment creation.
      private static long serialVersionUID
      The Constant serialVersionUID.
      DtDateAndTime vpLastReminder
      The last time the coordinators have been reminded about outstanding crisises.
      PtBoolean vpStarted
      If the system has been started or not.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public PtBoolean init(DtInteger aNextValueForAlertID,
                      DtInteger aNextValueForCrisisID,
                      DtDateAndTime aClock,
                      DtSecond aCrisisReminderPeriod,
                      DtSecond aMaxCrisisReminderPeriod,
                      DtDateAndTime aVpLastReminder,
                      PtBoolean aVpStarted)
        Initialises the system's state.
        Parameters:
        aNextValueForAlertID - The next index value available for the alert ID
        aNextValueForCrisisID - The next index value available for the crisis ID
        aClock - The current system date and time
        aCrisisReminderPeriod - The set crisis reminder period, if a crisis hasn't been handled within the period, coordinators will be warned.
        aMaxCrisisReminderPeriod - The max crisis reminder period, if a crisis hasn't been handled within the period, coordinators will be warned.
        aVpLastReminder - The last time the coordinators have been reminded about outstanding crisises.
        aVpStarted - If the system has been started or not
        Returns:
        Success of the initialisation
